title: How I worked with javascript event handlers
text: In my highschool years I took an AP computer science course that focused on the history of computer technology and the use of JavaScript. We used a website called code.org to learn and submit our code however this website was linked to my highschool email and thus all the programs I wrote have been lost to time.

title: How I worked with javascript event handlers
text: In my highschool years I took an AP computer science course that focused on the history of computer technology and the use of JavaScript. We used a website called code.org to learn and submit our code however this website was linked to my highschool email and thus all the programs I wrote have been lost to time.

title: How I worked with javascript event handlers
text:
The Main Program
As the program was lost I can’t supply code snippets as example but I will do my best to explain the code and what it intended to do. The program was a mostly simple clicker game, a game where one would click on objects on screen to either collect money, do damage, block attacks whatever the game intended clicks to be. My game in particular used clicks as a method of “attacking” the “enemy” that was on screen. The goal was to click and defeat the enemy in a fast enough time to not take damage as your only had 5 hearts or chances to be hit before you lost. With this goal the program used a time based code to check how much time had passed between clicks and deal damage if the time had reached a certain threshold. That is the basis of the code and its intended use.

title: How I worked with javascript event handlers
text:
The Event Handlers
In order to achieve the plan of a clicker game I had to learn and use event handlers. Event Handlers are bits of code that accept user input then do an action based on this input. In the case of this program the evnet handlers looked for a click action from either a mouse or a touchscreen and subtracted health from the enemy on screen if that click happened within the bounds of the enemies image. In order for the event handlers to continue to run the program ran almost entirely within a while loop that monitored the players “health score” which upon hitting zero would disable the while loop and go to a game over screen. This was only one example of the use of event handlers. They are very versatile and are used to accept multiple different types of user inputs in fact every game that youve played, app you’ve used, or website you’ve interacted with has used event handlers to some degree!

title: Welcome
text:
This site is a project for CSC324. The following website will contain articles discussing past homework answers, my process of creating nthe theme of this website, and a blog with some interesting posts!
This website was made with Quarto!
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Welcome
text:
This site is a project for CSC324. The following website will contain articles discussing past homework answers, my process of creating nthe theme of this website, and a blog with some interesting posts!
This website was made with Quarto!
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.

title: Recustomizing a Site
text: For our website project we were asked to make a unique change to our website, preferably one that we would have to learn how to go about doing. I deceided to customize my website with unique backgrounds, fontcolors(albeit those that worked with the backgrounds), logos, and a favicon. To implement these changes I had to spend quite a bit of time researching websites and quarto itself to find how to work with the preset file structure and the languages that quarto uses.

title: Recustomizing a Site
Recustomizing a Site
Recustomizing a Site
text:
Logo’s
The process of adding a logo was fairly simple thanks to quartos design adding a logo was as simple as using the logo line and directly providing the filepath to the image that i wanted to use as a logo.
logo: /images/wolf.png
The same process as above applies to the favicon with the only difference being the word logo being exchanged for favicon.
 favicon: /images/favicon.png

title: Recustomizing a Site
text:
Fonts
The process of changing the font had me stumped at first as I was unsure where it belonged. I eventually found that the font is controlled by the .yml file under the main format section, the font would be placed under the theme, there I had adjusted the font to be a white color and the coloration of links to be yellowed. I also considered changing the actual font itself but decided I prefered the default one that was already in use.
fontcolor: "#FFFFFF"
linkcolor: "#ccff99"

title: A Class Called Group
text:
This article will discuss a solution to a question from chapter 6 of Eloquent JavaScript 3rd edition (2018).
The following is the problem statement from the text book.

Write a class called Group (since Set is already taken). Like Set, it has add, delete, and has methods. Its constructor creates an empty group, add adds a value to the group (but only if it isn’t already a member), delete removes its argument from the group (if it was a member), and has returns a Boolean value indicating whether its argument is a member of the group.

A Class Called Group

About
text: My name is Sean Switzer i’m a sophmore at georgetown college and am looking to major in software design and programming.

title: About
text: My name is Sean Switzer i’m a sophmore at georgetown college and am looking to major in software design and programming.

title: About
text:
Background and Today
I was introduced to programming in a highschool engineering course, in which we started learning the C# language to use with vex robotics programming. Following this introduction I fell in love with programming and the many puzzles it provides, I went on to study javascript in an AP computer science course learning the history of computing, the use of binary, hexadecimal, and ascii. I started working on programs that could be run on mobile devices and programmed a basic time based clicker game. Now I am currently attending my third computer science class CSC 324 and looking to further my studies in the following semesters.

title: Recursive Recursion
text:
The following is the problem statement from chapter 3 of the text book Eloquent JavaScript 3rd edition (2018).

We’ve seen that % (the remainder operator) can be used to test whether a number is even or odd by using % 2 to see whether it’s divisible by two. Here’s another way to define whether a positive whole number is even or odd:
Zero is even.
One is odd.
For any other number N, its evenness is the same as N - 2.
Define a recursive function isEven corresponding to this description. The function should accept a single parameter (a positive, whole number) and return a Boolean.

This solution looks to answer this problem in the best way possible.

title: Recursive Recursion
Recursive Recursion
Articles
text:
Two of the following articles go in depth with my solutions to two of the homework assignments I had this semester.
The first article, “A Class called Group”, discusses the solution to a problem that uses a group and it’s methods to answer the problem.
The second article, “Recursive Recursion”, displays the use of recursive functions to solve the problem given in the homework assignment.
The Third Article discusses the changes I made to my website to give it a customized look and theme.

title: Have you ever attempted to mod a game?
text: Video game modding is a large undertaking especially for games for games that are still receiving updates as these updates often change the internal program of the game itself and force modders to rewrite their programs for parity. These modders, the creators of mods, have to learn the language used for a game and consider the code the game uses then redesign it to fit the plan they have. This requires a large deal of skill as it requires the ability to read, interpret, and reapply another groups code.

title: Have you ever attempted to mod a game?
text: Video game modding is a large undertaking especially for games for games that are still receiving updates as these updates often change the internal program of the game itself and force modders to rewrite their programs for parity. These modders, the creators of mods, have to learn the language used for a game and consider the code the game uses then redesign it to fit the plan they have. This requires a large deal of skill as it requires the ability to read, interpret, and reapply another groups code.

title: Have you ever attempted to mod a game?
text:
My Attempt
I myself have attempted to mod a game called terraria, a game that uses the C++ language to execute its programs. I created a simple mod in this language that designed a basic tool for the player to use, the art of said tool was very primitive to say the least but the tool and its materials all functioned. Just making that one tool was a large undertaking however as it required me to not only learn aspects of C++ but also required knowledge of the game itself and how it ran, requiring me to add event tags to items and materials that allowed the game to recognize what an item was and how it was supposed to be catogorized and used in its processes. Suffice to say I find the prospect of modding interesting yet exceedingly difficult and believe it takes a large amount of skill and understanding of programming in all languages.
